result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Pekrun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 1 day was granted.
May be transferred to Milwaukee or Sheboygan County.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Victim or their residence.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Sign Medical Release for Agent.
Give Agent access to all financial information / employment information.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Pekrun

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
From the defense.

Defendant Matthew R Pekrun in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Shellow makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

100  Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 1 days).  

Term of Probation: 1 Year may be transferred to Milwaukee or Sheboygan County

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Victim or their residence.
	
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Sign Medical Release for Agent;

Give agent access to all financial information / employment information 

Seek employment;

Condition Time: 15 days jail without Huber STAYED 

COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Paralegal of Robin Shellow appeared for the attorney advising Attorney Shellow cannot appear today.  Defendant Matthew R Pekrun in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew R Pekrun in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shellow advises she only discovered this morning that she doesn't have discovery and moves to adjourn this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew R Pekrun in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shellow advises it is her fault they are not prepared for a pleah today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Matthew R Pekrun in court.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew R Pekrun in court with attorney Robin Shellow.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shellow needs to have Attorney Morin sign off on this matter so she can represent the defendant.  The next date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim or the residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Matthew R Pekrun in court with attorney Robin Shellow.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will quash the warrant.  Court will reinstate the signature bond with same conditions.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Matthew R Pekrun did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 9:57 - scheduled for 9:30.  Court orders capias.  Court orders bail revoked
